parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To cast the line (for sounding), I sound. From bolis; to heave the lead.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
Twenty. Of uncertain affinity; a score.
A fathom, about five or six feet. From oregomai; a stretch of the arms, i.e. A fathom.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To put apart, separate, put some distance between. From dia and histemi; to stand apart, i.e. to remove, intervene.
Short, little, few. Of uncertain affinity; short.

word: they took another set of soundings
parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To cast the line (for sounding), I sound. From bolis; to heave the lead.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
Fifteen. From deka and pente; ten and five, i.e. Fifteen.
A fathom, about five or six feet. From oregomai; a stretch of the arms, i.e. A fathom.
